item.title: How to change the port of my server
item.dc:creator: @Javas_My_Betch Javas My Betch
item.description:
@Javas_My_Betch wrote:

To change the port:

1/ Open up server.java
2/ Search for “public static int serverlistenerPort”
3/ Replace the port number to what ever port you want it changed to… , and then save , and compile.

Read full topic
item.source: How to change the port of my server

item.title: How to change the port of my server
item.dc:creator: @flipmc flipmc
item.description:
@flipmc wrote:

Use MoparScape client, with your server.
Maybe that would work, and the first video said;
“Error, enable to startup on 43594 - port already use?”
Which means, you opened a runserver.bat or a compiler.bat already.

If that doesn’t work, re-install source OR get a new one.
Post any questions, and I’ll try to help.

OH AND, go to your client clicl “File” and “New Port”.
Whatever your runserver.bat says, put in that port.
[hr]
